content.question: The project funding decisions made by two interdependent research companies, Creative and Genezyz, resulted in a profit of <math alttext="$4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>$4</mtext></math> million for Creative and a profit of <math alttext="$5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>$5</mtext></math> million for Genezyz. Which of the following is required for this combination of project choices to be a Nash equilibrium?

choices.label: Genezyz charges a lower price to its customers than Creative does.
Neither firm has a dominant strategy.
Neither firm could earn higher profits by unilaterally changing its project choice.
Creative could earn a higher profit if it chose a different project when Genezyz chose its initial project.
The combined profits of the two firms are maximized at the current combination of project choices.

content.answer: Neither firm could earn higher profits by unilaterally changing its project choice.
